entry.title: customization: Reorder event rewriters
entry.content:
The event rewriters should be in the following order:

1. Peripheral Customization

2. Pre-Rewritten Event forwarder

3. a11y rewriter



This order is necessary so a11y features can use peripheral

customization rewritten events. Additionally, the pre-rewritten event

forwarder must come after the peripheral customization rewriter so that

mouse button events are included in the event forwarder. The intention

of the pre-rewritten event forwarder is intended to bypass keyboard

rewrites which does not happen in peripheral customization.



Bug: b/241965717

Change-Id: I8701e104fd883c5247e990a53625affc851bf034

entry.title: DOM: Introduce `ObservableEventListenerOptions` dictionary
entry.content:
This CL introduces `ObservableEventListenerOptions` as an optional

dictionary parameter to `EventTarget#on()`. This allows

EventTarget-returned Observables to register "passive" or

"capture/bubble" event listeners, for parity with the traditional

`addEventListener()` mechanism.



R=masonf@chromium.org

entry.title: [Tab Switcher] Fill in TabSwitcherPaneCoordinator
entry.content:
Fork of the TabSwitcherCoordinator. A large portion of the code is

no longer relevant due to not implementing the full TabSwitcher API

e.g. the TabListDelegate is not supported.



Portions of initialization now exist in the

TabSwitcherPaneCoordinatorFactory.



Reset handling, Price tracking, incognito reauth and other "common"

functions like subscribing to menu inputs have been lifted into the

panes.



Some methods will need to be added back with new geometry information

for the animations (this will be a separate CL). Some for testing method

have also been removed, but may need to be re-introduced later for

integration tests.



Due to these changes a ~600 line file is now only ~400.



Bug: 1505772

entry.title: Exempt test filter files from the production freeze.
entry.content:
We've entered the holiday freeze part of the year and want to

block most infra changes, at least without approval from infra leads.



However, some changes only need to change entries in filter files,

and those kinda aren't infra changes, they're more like dev changes

(or at least they're infra changes that are real unlikely to break

the infra), so this CL changes the presubmit check to ignore

filter files and only fail if non-filter-file changes in

//testing/buildbot are present.



This doesn't catch places where we skip just a few tests via

a command line arg, but this is better than nothing.



(Note that this change itself, since it's changing a PRESUBMIT.py

file, needs approval to skip the freeze :).



Ignore-Freeze: true

Bug: 1512209

Change-Id: I1a16d59b084de14e393b1990aedcead34bcf40c6

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5126126

entry.title: [Downloads] Elide beginning of display URL on chrome://downloads
entry.content:
To avoid URL spoofs by truncation of very long download URLs, this CL

changes the elision of the display URL on chrome://downloads from

eliding the end to eliding the beginning. Because the eTLD+1 aka

registrable domain of the URL is at the end, we want to always display

that as it is security-relevant.



Note that eliding the beginning may truncate the scheme (http/https) of

the URL. This is acceptable because, due to insecure download warnings,

the user has already been alerted of any insecure (http) downloads, so

the scheme of the download URL is a less important signal.



Screenshots:

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1G5ChkHbM82HjFrHPVerzwf4UB1MmQmiZ



Bug: 1514925

Change-Id: I61639cdf4b6682a2ba8961822f22bd7621e8ad13

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5170825

entry.title: [Code Health] Fix dangling pointer in CloudPolicyCore
entry.content:
Currently CloudPolicyStore is owned by CloudPolicyManager subclasses,

and CloudPolicyCore is owned by CloudPolicyManager base class, therefore

the store is destroyed earlier and leading to the dangling pointer in

CloudPolicyCore.



This CL moves the ownership of the CloudPolicyStore to

CloudPolicyManager base class and ensures that it outlives

CloudPolicyCore. The subclasses may hold raw pointers to the store.



Bug: 1512675

entry.title: [accessibility] Introduce ScopedAccessibilityMode
entry.content:
A ScopedAccessibilityMode instance can be created (via

content::BrowserAccessibilityState::CreateScopedModeFor...) to apply a

set of AXMode flags to all WebContentses in the browser process, to all

WebContentses associated with a specific BrowserContext, or to a

specific WebContents. When created and destroyed, the union of the mode

flags in all live instances are applied to all relevant WebContentses.

This mechanism allows different controllers of accessibility modes to

enable/disable mode flags without interfering with one another. In this

stage, the only controller using the new mechanism is

BrowserAccessibilityStateImpl.



Today's callers of methods like {Add,Remove}AccessibilityModeFlags and

NotifyAddAXModeFlags will be migrated to using ScopedAccessibilityMode

in subsequent CLs.



Bug: 1470199

Change-Id: I22a2aac3e70743b65afcafcd471d2748cc0281c0

AX-Relnotes: n/a.

entry.title: [ios, MagicStack] Use singular MostVisitedTilesConfig for MVT module
entry.content:
This change adds MostVisitedTilesConfig, which serves as a simple

config object to hold all the information needed to set up the four

MVTs. In preparation for MagicStack's migration to UICollectionView,

each module cell needs one config item. MostVisitedTilesConfig's parent

class MagicStackModule will be the base class for all module configs.



As a part of this change (also in preparation for the UICollectionView

migration), MagicStackModuleContainer has a new -configureWithConfig:

API that the MVT module logic uses to configure a module cell.

This architecture migration moves the contentView creation

responsibility to MagicStackModuleContainer internally.



A placeholder module type and PlaceholderConfig are also created in

order to allow placeholder cells to easily fit into a design where

a generic list of items will represent what is being shown.



that calling -shareURL: shows a sharing modal.



Low-Coverage-Reason: HARD_TO_TEST it was not trivial to simply verify

Change-Id: Ia507047f49eaf0c3f675e80c990f7874440b8a61

entry.title: Add devtools.timeline category into etw keyword list
entry.content:
FireIdleCallback event used to be fired when etw session is enabled.

However devtools.timeline category was never in the etw keyword list.

It worked because of CategoryToKeyword function had a bug.

Now that bug has been fixed, devtools.timeline is needed in order to

get the FireIdleCallback event to be fired when etw session is on.

entry.title: firmware_update: Add metric to track the duration of successful requests
entry.content:
This CL adds a new metric type called `ChromeOS.FirmwareUpdateUi.RequestSucceededWithDuration.

RequestId{DeviceRequestId}`.



This metric records the duration and ID of a device request if it was

successful. Specifically, when the FwupdStatus changes from

WaitingForUser to anything else, the request is considered successful.

entry.title: Design and implement check membership strategy phases for 28DA use case
entry.content:
Consists of two phases: First phase check membership 3 most likely days.

Depending on the membership result we perform a binary search across

the remaining 25 days to determine the last ping date.



Design: https://goto.google.com/28da-check-membership-rollout

entry.title: [gpu][Multiplanar] Fix check for prev_byte_size in WritePixelsYUV
entry.content:
Fix check in WritePixelsYUV for both raster and passthrough decoders.

This check currently checks if plane offset is greater than previous

plane offset + current plane size but shound instead check if current

plane offset is greater than previous plane offset + previous plane

size. This fixes the checks.

entry.title: Create single Jank-Tracker thread only.
entry.content:
Before this change we were getting multiple "Jank-Tracker" threads in

multi-window case for chromium and multi-instance case for webview.

Essentially having multiple windows in chromium would create one thread

each for window, and having multiple instances of webview in an app

would create one thread each for an instance of webview. This change

fixes this to have just one Jank-Tracker thread.



Bug: b/301561001

entry.title: Revert "[iOS] Promo to upload bookmarks should be limited to left-behind ones"
entry.content:
This reverts commit c8123bec897b539a37b49f8fe29376594c8b089d.



Reason for revert:

LUCI Bisection has identified this change as the culprit of a build failure. See the analysis: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/bisection/compile-analysis/b/8759449235937807505



Sample failed build: https://ci.chromium.org/b/8759449235937807505



If this is a false positive, please report it at https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/entry?comment=Analysis%3A+https%3A%2F%2Fci.chromium.org%2Fui%2Fp%2Fchromium%2Fbisection%2Fcompile-analysis%2Fb%2F8759449235937807505&components=Tools%3ETest%3EFindit&labels=LUCI-Bisection-Wrong%2CPri-3%2CType-Bug&status=Available&summary=Wrongly+blamed+https%3A%2F%2Fchromium-review.googlesource.com%2Fc%2Fchromium%2Fsrc%2F%2B%2F5164234



Original change's description:

> [iOS] Promo to upload bookmarks should be limited to left-behind ones

>

> The batch upload promo from bookmarks manager should not be shown if the

> user has already uploaded the sync-left behind bookmarks.

> This should be the solution to avoid the confusion that happens because

> both local and sync left-behind bookmarks are in the local store.

>

> To guarantee that the promo should never be shown after the user

> chooses to upload these bookmarks, this CL introduces a pref for that,

> and writes/reads to it.

>

> Note: the left-behind bookmarks in this usage are: all the bookmarks

> that exist in the local store, where the current account is the last syncing account, till the user uploads them using this promo.

>

> Fixed: 1513110

> Change-Id: Id5fef0ed0d0a88f42401e3c7ad7a3699dcff63c7

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5164234

> Commit-Queue: Jood Hajeer

> Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1244122}

entry.title: [AppName] Fix the issue of garbled characters when the application name is in Chinese
entry.content:
When the value of the name field in the .desktop file is in Chinese,

garbled characters may appear.



It is best to use the conversion from utf8 to utf16.



Steps to reproduce the problem:

1. Choose a file with a desktop type suffix,

such as sublime_text.desktop，

the value of the name field is in Chinese characters.

2. Customize an external protocol name: plain_test.

3. Terminal execution

xdg-settings set default-url-scheme-handler plain_test sublime_text.desktop.

4. Create a local HTML and add

Open myapp.

5. Open this HTML using a browser and click on the hyperlink inside.

6. Chinese garbled characters may appear.



Change-Id: I8ac0f80f29015e09fe1b35be44030bf1be05c53b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5176326

entry.title: 🧇 Record waffle metrics on Android OS choice import
entry.content:
Changes TemplateURLService::SetUserSelectedDefaultSearchProvider

to take an enum referring to the screen where the user made the selection



Passing this information from the UI all the way to

setting the new DSP allows logging some choice screen related

metrics without having to deal with separate timing-dependent calls.

This CL introduces this API and updates call sites we're interested

in for the Waffle project across all platforms, to pass the enum

instead of logging separately, and uses a new fallback enum value

(kOther) to avoid affecting other call sites.

entry.title: [iOS] Promo to upload bookmarks should be limited to left-behind ones
entry.content:
The batch upload promo from bookmarks manager should not be shown if the

user has already uploaded the sync-left behind bookmarks.

This should be the solution to avoid the confusion that happens because

both local and sync left-behind bookmarks are in the local store.



To guarantee that the promo should never be shown after the user

chooses to upload these bookmarks, this CL introduces a pref for that,

and writes/reads to it.



Note: the left-behind bookmarks in this usage are: all the bookmarks

that exist in the local store, where the current account is the last syncing account, till the user uploads them using this promo.



Fixed: 1513110

entry.title: [Extensions] Remove HasEffectiveAccessToAllHosts in PermissionsData
entry.content:
HasEffectiveAccessToAllHosts() is a forward for the active

permissions that acquires a lock for the permissions. This allows non-

UI (main) threads to safely query the permissions data for these

methods.



The previous uses of that have been moved to the UI thread, thus callers

can now use active_permissions() to directly compute the access. That way, we can remove HasEffectiveAccessToAllHosts.

entry.title: Address Extra VPBlit Operations During Media Foundation fullscreen
entry.content:
This change addresses an issue where the finalized rect for Media

Foundation playback via the Direct Composition presentaiton path

was not equal to the full screen size.



In certain cases when watching 1080p content on a 1080p device we see

the visual_transform have a half pixel offset on the y-axis. The result

of this was a finalized onscreen rect of [1920, 1081] instead of The

expected [1920, 1080]. As a result of this DWM does not consider this as

a fullscreen scenario so we may see things like additional copies (e.g.

NV12-to-NV12 or NV12-to-ARGB) as well as features like DMRRS or CABC

not getting applied.



I found a set of issues with the way we were doing our current

calculation which are addressed here:

* On screen rect passed to AdjustTargetToOptimalSizeIfNeeded was

untransformed.

* AdjustTargetToOptimalSizeIfNeeded operates assuming the clipping

rect is applied but the rect set on the DComp Surface Proxy was not

clipped.

* AdjustTargetToFullScreenSizeIfNeeded would early exit if the clipped

onscreen rect equaled monitor size, but this path didn't validate if

there was any translation. That translation is still applied in the

DComp case.

* The way AdjustTargetToFullScreenSizeIfNeeded accounted for offset

from origin would not work for a partial pixel offset which wouldn't

modify the origin but would alter the finalized size.



Bug: 1469519

Change-Id: I93d79598b5607197f5ebc794b37c0ceefe2cb9c7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4893042

Commit-Queue: William Carr

Reviewed-by: Maggie Chen

entry.title: Accessibility: Generalize PumpkinInstaller
entry.content:
This change is part of a multi-CL effort to add a DLC for FaceGaze. To

begin with, we first need to generalize PumpkinInstaller into a

generic class that can also install other DLCs (namely the facegaze

DLC, which is added in https://crrev.com/c/5148582). This change renames

PumpkinInstaller to AccessibilityDlcInstaller and makes some changes

so that the new interface makes sense. Further logic changes to

download the FaceGaze DLC will come in follow-up CLs.

entry.title: Use chromeos, fuchsia, and google audit sources for cargo vet
entry.content:
Instead of using the aggregated one, use each of the original

sources. This will prevent a recursion if/when the google repo

begins aggregating chromium's audits.

entry.title: [UPMLocalPwd] Add the code for opening Safety Check in Chrome Settings
entry.content:
The code that opens Safety Check in Settings will be used by the

PhishGuard dialog to launch Password Checkup. When the compromised

credentials appear both in the account and local store, the button

for checking passwords will lead to the Safety Check menu that will

offer the option to see both the local and account Password Checkup.

entry.title: Fix broken AutofillMetrics test
entry.content:
crrev.com/c/5173525 recently excluded kLegacy patterns from the non-

active patterns in Chrome-branded builds. As a result, some of the UKM

metrics now emit a kHeuristicTypeLegacyName of UNKNOWN_TYPE.



That CL was supposed fix all unit test (see changes in

autofill_metrics_unittest.cc), but missed the

CreditCardFormRecordOnIFrames test. This is causing failures on one of

the builders now:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-chrome/38453/test-results



This CL fixes the test the same way the other tests were fixed in the

aforementioned CL.

entry.title: [Passwords] Remove pwd generation element getter from VotesUploader
entry.content:
VotesUploader is a class responsible for uploading crowdsourced votes.

It shouldn't be used for other purposes, such as storing and providing

non vote-related data.

Uploading votes for forms hosted on localhost will be disabled soon,

this CL ensures the corresponding form managers will not need to

use the non-functional VotesUploader.

entry.title: [//content] Refine PepperGraphics2DHost GLES2 SharedImage usage
entry.content:
This class creates SharedImages that are written to via the raster

interface (which might be going over GLES2) and sent to the display

compositor. They are never read via the GLES2 interface.



Note: AFAICT the usages here should have RASTER included and should

have GLES2_WRITE included only if the context provider doesn't support

OOP rasterization. However, that would result in potential functional

changes (i.e., different SI backings could potentially be selected). As

this is NaCL code, I'm particularly wary of functional changes. I'll

put that CL up for discussion as a followup. In the meantime, this CL

is guaranteed not to result in functional changes as nothing on the

service side (currently) distinguishes between treatment of GLES2_READ

and treatment of GLES2_WRITE.



Bug: 1512542
